string.text: Salutations, fellow brother. My duty is to provide technical support for our brethren in the area.
To which places may I travel, brother?

There are several - we have routes that lead to the Red Forest, Outskirts and Pripyat. I cannot take you to any of these locations myself, but you may go with your brothers - for a fee. I don't believe you'll find it a problem, however.
A donde me pueden llevar los guias?
To the Red Forest for six thousand rubles, Outskirts for two thousand and Pripyat for one thousand.
I'd like to travel somewhere, brother.
Por supuesto. ¿A dónde te gustaría ir?
To the Red Forest. %c[d_orange][6000 RU]
To the Outskirts. %c[d_orange][2000 RU]
A Pripyat. %c[d_orange][1000 RU]
He cambiado de opinion.
Quien eres?
Nice to meet you, bro. Name's Garry, and I'm a guide - usually roam around the center of the Zone. I can take you to the Bar, Pripyat, the Red Forest, Zaton and the Jupiter Underground.
Forgot. Where can you lead me?

I can offer trips to the Bar for six thousand rubles, Pripyat for three thousand, the Red Forest for twenty-five hundred, the Skadovsk in Zaton for two thousand and the Jupiter Underground for fifteen hundred.
Take me somewhere.
Sure, where to?
To the Bar. %c[d_orange][6000 RU]
To Pripyat. %c[d_orange][3000 RU]
To the Red Forest. %c[d_orange][2500 RU]
To Jupiter Underground. %c[d_orange][1500 RU]
To Zaton. %c[d_orange][2000 RU]
He cambiado de opinion.
Are you in charge here?
That I am. Name's Loki, right hand of Lukash at this station.
Loki? An interesting name - like the Scandinavian deity.
It is. That's what they called me in the early days, right around when the Brain Scorcher showed up. Those were crazy times.
Could you tell me more about the events after the Scorcher?

Claro. When the Scorcher was first shut down back in 2012, my squad launched a campaign towards the north. We went on for some time, going through different places... As the Chernobyl power plant loomed on the horizon, we decided to look for a place to set up camp and found this station while it was empty. Duty arrived soon after. We were duking it out when suddenly an emission struck. You must understand that getting zombified is a pretty shitty way to go, no matter who you are. So, at great risk...I let Duty inside before the storm really got going. We called a building-wide truce, agreeing to keep all weapons holstered and knives sheathed inside this station. We'd still continue to harass each other outside of it, of course.
And what happened to the Dutyers stationed here? Where are they now?

That's not an easy question. Not long ago, a stalker by the name of Alexander appeared and helped the people here considerably - man did a lot of good things. Thanks to him, everyone was maintaining a careful balance in this station. Faction tensions in the building were even starting to defuse. That is, until the Monolith popped their ugly heads above ground again and started looking in our direction.
What happened next?

Well, Colonel Shulga - the leader of the Dutyers that were here - decided he wasn't going to stand for cultists running freely across the Zone again. He took as many men as he could, said "Don't worry, we'll be back in time for drinks" and marched straight for Pripyat. The Brain Scorcher reactivated not too long after and...we never saw them since.
Was his sacrifice worth it?
...No. To think of the risks I took when I first let his men in here all those years ago...these days they're probably taking their drinks alongside the brainwashed and the walking dead...
...Damn.
Hey, Loki! Delivery from Lukash!
Yeah, this'll help. One good turn deserves another, as the old cliche goes. Here, take this suit. Its old owner won't be needing it anymore anyways.
¿Qué puedo venderte hoy?
Hola stalker. ¿Qué necesitas?
I'm Trapper... There's no need to introduce yourself.
Toma, elige.¿Qué te gustaría decirme?
What do you do?
Well, I'm Trapper and I used to hunt mutants that were a danger to stalkers... Nowadays, I take orders and give them to younger hunters. I train them and teach them hunting tactics...
Why don't you hunt anymore?

I’m getting old, man. That’s why Fox died... He was my partner and friend. We hunted many a beast together, shoulder to shoulder... Then we ran into these two chimeras by Zaton that haven’t been seen in the Zone for eighteen months... One knocked Fox to the ground before I could even get my shotgun out. When I wounded the other one, they ran off... I hope they burn in hell forever!
Tell me about hunting mutants...

Chimeras are very dangerous nocturnal predators. They try to get behind you under cover of darkness and leap on top of you. If you know there's a chimera around, keep checking your back and cover your friends' asses...

Burers use gravitation attacks... When at close proximity they'll throw you and when they're far away they'll try to throw something at you... Your best bet is to keep them at medium range from you and keep moving, unless you enjoy getting hit by something heavy... But be careful to conserve your energy! Burers can use directed gravitational impulses to yank weapons out of your hands and if you're tired it might just work.

There are two types of poltergeists. The first type sends items crashing into the enemy using gravitation, while the second type is the fire poltergeist that uses flames to burn its victims. Inexperienced hunters try to circle around them to evade their attacks... The trick is to know that poltergeists can't see or hear in the usual sense of those words and use that to your advantage. They sense objects that move in the gravitational field... So a seasoned hunter freezes as soon as he sees a poltergeist, fires and then freezes again, rinse repeat.

The most difficult thing about hunting pseudogiants is killing them. They can take incredible punishment without so much as batting an eyelid... All I can say is that you may want to try using a shotgun at close range. Just remember that pseudogiant attacks can detach anything that's not been fixed to concrete. Attack it from above... and make sure that whatever you're standing on can withstand some damage.

Controllers use your own mind against you. When you're hunting one, it's important to use cover, because it must see you to affect your mind... Also, they're quite slow, so if your life is at stake, use grenades.
I got work to do, we can chitchat about mutants later.
¿Qué te trae por aquí?¿Estás buscando suministros médicos o solo has venido aquí para charlar?
I need medical assistance.
Let's have a look...
Let's have a look... Well, your liver is bigger than I'd expect, but that's an occupational hazard, right? Apart from that, you're as healthy as a burer.

Well, of course you need to be fixed up but I'm not going to do it for free. My price is 1850 RU for complete recovery, regardless of the severity of your injuries. However, removing the radiation from your system is a separate service, another 1480 RU on top.
What are you saying? Am I already dead?
Well, I'll pay you. In the end, it makes no sense to take money to the grave.
Shit, that's too expensive for me!
I'm not going to pay that, thank you! I'd rather die!
I don't have that much money. Treat only the radiation, please.
I have a first aid kit, so treat me for just the radiation.
Wait a minute... now you're good as new. Warranty - two years if you don't leave the station.
I don't give out loans, look elsewhere.
Then... To a good death, buddy.
Well, come here. Don't need more antirad.
Entonces, ¿qué tienes que decir?
What's your business here?
Tell me about your place in Freedom.
It's a long story. What do you want to know?
¿Qué es lo que haces aquí?

We're making sure that various officials don't conceal anything from the common folk. You know how it is: as soon as they find a new lab or some documents that shed light on the secrets of the Zone, they immediately organize a military operation and clean everything up better than a friggin' hoover. La única forma de averiguarlo es llegar primero.
¿Qué te trajo al centro de la Zona?

Well, the boys felt like taking a stroll in a new place... Es una broma. It's an opportunity to find stuff that the world ain't seen before. This place is pretty untouched as far as the Zone goes, so there's something new everywhere you look.
La que no es fácil de encontrar...
Mostly locked doors and some weird new artefacts.
Un stalker común pasa por alto esos lugares, los deja a un lado, hay muchos rumores diferentes sobre lo que está pasando allí y sobre los que van y no regresan.

¿Cómo terminaste en Libertad? Mind you, in those days, they weren't leaders: they were regular hippies. Eso sí, por aqule entonces, no eran líderes: eran hippies normales. Entonces, cuando vine a la Zona en busca de artefactos y me encontré con rostros familiares, pensé que mejor ir con quien conozco.
¿Qué pasó en los almacenes militares?

They're idiots, that's what I think. If Voronin didn't have his head up his ass, he'd have sent reinforcements up here just like Freedom did when the Monolith returned. If Shulga wasn't such an idiot, he wouldn't have disappeared trying to save this station! If their grunts today had more than two brain cells to rub together, they'd spend more time trying to find their lost comrades and less time taking fucking potshots at us. If any of them had any sense at all, they'd enjoy their lives to the fullest. Not throw them away trying to eradicate the most unique scientific marvel the world has ever seen.
Está bien. Olvídalo.
Whatever floats your boat.
No hubo tiempo para prepararse, sólo pudimos construir unas malas barricadas rápidamente. A juzgar por las conversaciones de radio, fue el infierno en la tierra, un exterminio despiadado.

Nuestros hombres lucharon hasta el final y todavía pudieron dar buena reprimenda... pero finalmente perdimos la base.\nMuchos de nuestros amigos murieron allí, fue muy duro para la moral, y silenciosamente muchos comenzaron a abandonar el grupo. No hay más entregas, la conexión se rompió, vivimos sólo de las viejas existencias y de lo que conseguimos por aquí por nuestra cuenta. The drinks ain't nothing special, but this is a welcoming and friendly place!
I got all the shit you're ever gonna need. Olvídalo.No hay problema. Hola viajero. El abastecimiento no es el mejor, pero es abundante.
Tell me about this place.

Welcome to Yanov Station, fellow stalker! Full of jolly people! Yes...full of them! Friends and companions that you can talk, drink and gamble with in-between trips through the Zone. Wanna buy something to help you out? Guns, ammo, drugs, weed, I've got you covered, mate. Better safe than sorry!
¡Bienvenido, stalker!Esto no es que sea un restaurante, por supuesto, pero no pasamos hambre.
Tell me about this place.

Eh, well, there is not much to say. After much negotation I managed to convince the Ukrainian Ministry of Education to establish another facility in the Zone once the Brain Scorcher had been disabled. However, we were offered no protection because the accompanying military operation utterly failed. With state of the art equipment but no manpower to speak of we have to rely on hired stalkers most of the time. Needless to say, our capability and working conditions leave much to be desired. How are we supposed to make significant progress without any assistance from the outside?
Toma, elige.¿Qué te gustaría decirme?
Do you know anything about the Oasis?

Sí, por supuesto. We even once studied an artefact from that place, although it has since been requested for use in the outside world. The stalker who gave it to us - one Alexander Degtyarev - never revealed where the Oasis lies, however. If you were to find it, we'd pay handsomely for another Oasis artefact.
Toma, elige.¿Qué te gustaría decirme?
Ve y dile a %s que traiga su culo gordo aquí.
Doesn't he know I'm busy? Dile que venga aquí.
I don't get paid for walking. Dile que venga a verme.
¿Qué? Does he want a wheelchair? Ve a buscar %s y que venga a verme.
¿Dónde está %s? I can't fix it until he brings it here.
Si %s quiere, dile que venga aquí y que me lo quite.
¿Cómo dices? Si lo quiere, que venga y lo consiga. ¿De acuerdo?
Dile a ese calvo cabrón calvo que se arrastre hasta aquí.
No puedo dejar mi tienda sola. He's gotta come to me, eh?
¿Me ves como el chico de los recados? Dile a %s que lo haga él mismo.
